meanings.definition: A Jewish prayer book used during High Holy Days.
meanings.sent1: During Rosh Hashanah, the rabbi read from the machzors to lead the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The synagogue had a collection of machzors for the community to use during Yom Kippur.
meanings.sent3: The machzors were so heavy that the cantor joked about needing a weightlifting routine to carry them.
meanings.sent4: The words in the machzors lifted the spirits of the worshippers like a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: As the pages turned in the machzors, the prayers seemed to dance off the paper and into the hearts of the listeners.

meanings.definition: The plural form of machzor, referring to multiple prayer books.
meanings.sent1: The library had a shelf full of machzors for different occasions and holidays.
meanings.sent2: When the congregation gathered, they each held their own machzors to follow along in prayer.
meanings.sent3: The rabbi accidentally dropped a stack of machzors, causing a domino effect of falling books.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the presence of the machzors, each one a gateway to spiritual connection.
meanings.sent5: The colorful covers of the machzors brightened the solemn atmosphere of the synagogue.
